WORDS: We are now boarding flight Z0741 to London Gatwick at gate A19.

VALUE: It was a nice, sunny morning along the path of a flight from Washington Dulles International Airport to London Gatwick Airport.
The story takes place on October 2, 2019.
Bob is on the flight, which is due to arrive at London Gatwick Airport in 5 minutes.
Bob is very excited about his trip because although his parents recently moved to Edinburgh, he has never been to the UK.
Finally, the plane lands and he goes to the baggage claim.
Bob walks through the airport towards the train station.
He walks into the train station and finds the Thameslink platform. He waits for a northbound train.
While he waits, a dark cloud appears on the horizon. It starts out as a calm drizzle, but later turns into a miserable thunderstorm.
A few minutes later, a British Rail Class 700 arrives at the platform and he boards the train.
That train stops at Coulsdon South, Purley, and South Croydon, before the stop where Bob disembarks, East Croydon.

However, partway through the route, a power station fails, changing the grid frequency, causing the train’s software to shut it down. As it turns out, this issue was caused by an update to the Siemens Desiro City software recently installed on the Class 700, 707, and 717.
Bob gets delayed, but luckily still has time to catch the train to Edinburgh.
At East Croydon, Bob transfers to London Tramlink, which uses Bombardier CR4000 trams.
He rides all the way to the end of the line, Wimbledon, via 14 different stations.
At Wimbledon, he changes to the London Underground District Line.
He rides the train, a London Underground S7 Stock, 12 stops to Victoria, where he changes to the Victoria Line.
He takes the Victoria Line 5 stops to King’s Cross & St. Pancras International.
At London King’s Cross station, Bob boards an LNER Azuma service to Edinburgh.
The train is a British Rail Class 801.
He is riding the entire route to Edinburgh. The train stops at Peterborough, Newark Northgate, York, Darlington, Durham, Newcastle, Alnmouth, Dunbar, and finally Edinburgh.
4 ½ hours later, the train arrives at Edinburgh Waverley station. Bob’s parents are waiting on the platform, but Bob never gets off.

The train operator walks through the train to the cab on the other end. He closes the doors and starts the train. The train begins moving. Bob’s parents go to the platform where the train will stop going in the other direction. Bob still doesn’t get off the train.
His parents locate a security guard at the station, who shows them security footage from the platform. Bob definitely didn’t get off of the train.

Next, the security guard calls the train operator, who returns the train to the depot. At the depot, they access security footage from the train, however a tall person was obstructing the view of Bob.
Detectives start looking for Bob all across the UK, until they eventually find him in Newcastle.

Apparently, the announcements on the Class 801 glitched, causing it to play the wrong announcement. When the announcements said “This station is Edinburgh Waverley”, the train had actually just arrived in Newcastle.
Bob was then reunited with his parents in Edinburgh, and the storm ended. It became a nice, sunny day, just like the morning when the plane landed.
Bob had an adventure trying to figure out where all of the things were in “Edinburgh”, which was actually Newcastle, but Bob didn’t know that.

MESSAGE: I had quite an adventure in Newcastle!
